admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of: (a) the
            execution of a feasibility study, including trial mining
            operations, to determine the technical, economic and
            financial viability of developing a potash project in
            Thailand; (b) provision of financial and legal services to
            assist the Government in negotiations with private investors
            in the potash sector; and (c) assistance to the Government
            in the formulation of broad potash development policies. The
            feasibility study will be executed in two phases, with the
            second phase carried out only if the first phase is
            satisfactory. Tests and core drilling work conducted to date
            indicate a good probability that a viable potash development
            project will emerge offering significant benefits to the
            economy by: (a) helping to industrialize a relatively
            underdeveloped region of the country, generating direct and
            indirect benefits through provision of infrastructure,
            services and related employment opportunities; (b)
            generating foreign exchange revenues which will help
            alleviate the country's balance of payments; (c)
            contributing to the Government's fiscal base through
            royalties and tax payments; and (d) providing the
            country's agriculture sector with an important input to production.
